page.title: 14COPPERAS WOOD - BIRDS
page.content: The wood, because it is now a Reserve has attracted many{birds.}In fact about 125 dirrerent types have been seen in the wood, many nesting. Among the regular visitors are the following: Redpole:{Blackcap:}Chiffchaff:{Wren Willow Warbler:{Garden Warbler: Kestrel:{Spotted Flycatcher:}Hoopo {Goldcrest:}Longtail Tit:{Cuckoo: Woodpecker (all 3):{Great Tit: Tree Creeper:{Blue Tit:}Hawfinch: In addition to these one or two rare birds have been seen including a Honey Buzzard and a Marsh Harrier. There are also several{water birds}and waders to be seen at the shore. Certainly a place worth a visit for the{ornithologist.
